metadata.synopsis: Dammon sees Karlach and feels her infernal engine. Him having been a weaponsmith in hell knows how to upgrade it and offers his services if the party brings him some infernal metal.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Have Karlach as an avatar or away from the party and speak with Dammon with her (WLD_Main_A: goto 177; 19; 562).COM branch:From crashsite:in debugbook: add karlach as companion in reCon: teleport Dammonclick on Dammon in the Den AOM Branch:from crashsitein reCon: teleport Dammonclick on Dammon in DenOOM Branch:From crashsite:in debugbook: add karlach as companion in reCon: teleport Dammonunlink player character and send them away from karlachdouble click karlachs icon to play as herclick on Dammon in the Den

40.speaker: Dammon
40.text: There you are. The infernal. I knew there must be one in the area. If we survive this, let's speak again. I'm a mechanic - we might be of use to one another.

47.speaker: Dammon
47.text: Thought I sensed an infernal around here. But you aren't from Elturel. What's your story?
47.context: NodeContext: Smelling the air, he can smell the infernal machinery on Karlach.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: I spent a good bit of time in the Hells. Enlisted against my will by the archdevil Zariel. Same as you, I suppose, if you're from Elturel.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: The devils were delighted when your city was swallowed up. I thought they had you for keeps. Glad you got out.

55.speaker: Dammon
55.text: I got lucky. It looks like you did too. And... you brought some infernal machinery with you.
55.context: NodeContext: Sniffing once or twice, he smells Karlach's infernal war machine heart

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: A little gift from Zariel. Keeps me burning hot.
2.context: NodeContext: "A little gift from Zariel" is with a bit of bile in your voice, though Karlach keeps things light. Lightly pounds chest with fist to indicate where the machine is.

29.speaker: Dammon
29.text: Very hot, by the smell of it. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
29.context: NodeContext: Sniffing once or twice, he smells Karlach's infernal war machine heart

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Be my guest. But don't get too close, or your eyes'll melt shut.

34.speaker: Dammon
34.text: Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.NodeContext: Ra-gnax: RAG-nax. metallurgised = i'm not sure how it's said in UK, i'd say 'metta-lur-gized' with roughly same emphasis on all syllables. demono-valves = de-MON-o-valves (nothing special here, just demonic valves).

16.speaker: Dammon
16.text: I might be able to help, but I'd need infernal iron. And a prayer that my hammer'll survive the work.

35.speaker: Dammon
35.text: That thing isn't meant to operate outside Avernus. I'm not sure how much longer it'll keep running, the way it's going.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: Will you be able to turn down the temperature a little? Worried I'm gonna go in for a handshake and singe someone's arm off one of these days.

1.speaker: Dammon
1.text: I'd worry about surviving the night first. But help one, help both: if we can cool you off, it'll stabilise your engine and allow you to touch whomever you please.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: Hey soldier - I think we picked up some of that infernal iron already. What say you - should I give it to him?
21.context: NodeContext: Intonation: "Hey soldier" is calling for the player's attention, like "you there".

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Absolutely - let's see what he can do.

85.speaker: Dammon
85.text: Hm - looks like it went missing. I'll be here if you find it.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Where should we look for infernal iron?

5.speaker: Dammon
5.text: I've sensed some during our travels. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: This will be handled in the map/ journal UI, no need for any anims here.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm not sure. Should we be tampering with an infernal machine?

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: You might be right. But... I'm running really hot. Might be nice if we could calm things down a little?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: We'll keep our eyes open for some iron.

71.speaker: Dammon
71.text: Meanwhile, I've still got plenty of weapons and armour in stock if you're looking to load up.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Personally, I'd like to know what infernal iron is worth.

45.speaker: Dammon
45.text: Not much to a regular smith, but a fair bit to a canny buyer.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: Not that that matters. We want to use it, not sell it.

54.speaker: Dammon
54.text: Thought I sensed an infernal around here. But you aren't from Elturel. What's your story?

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: Hey, I remember you. The weaponsmith, right? Your city was swallowed up by Avernus. And you were enlisted against your will, like my good self.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: I thought they had you for keeps. Glad you got out.

10.speaker: Dammon
10.text: I got lucky. It looks like you did too. And... you brought some infernal machinery with you.
10.context: NodeContext: Sniffing once or twice, he smells Karlach's infernal war machine heart

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: A little gift from Zariel. Keeps me burning hot.
90.context: NodeContext: "A little gift from Zariel" is with a bit of bile in your voice, though Karlach keeps things light. Lightly pounds chest with fist to indicate where the machine is.

70.speaker: Dammon
70.text: Very hot, by the smell of it. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
70.context: NodeContext: Sniffing once or twice, he smells Karlach's infernal war machine heart

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Be my guest. But don't get too close, or your eyes'll melt shut.

36.speaker: Dammon
36.text: Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.NodeContext: Ra-gnax: RAG-nax. metallurgised = i'm not sure how it's said in UK, i'd say 'metta-lur-gized' with roughly same emphasis on all syllables. demono-valves = de-MON-o-valves (nothing special here, just demonic valves).

93.speaker: Dammon
93.text: I might be able to help, but I'd need infernal iron. And a prayer that my hammer'll survive the work.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Will you be able to turn down the temperature a little? Worried I'm gonna go in for a handshake and singe someone's arm off one of these days.

87.speaker: Dammon
87.text: I'd worry about yourself first. That thing isn't meant to operate outside Avernus. I'm not sure how much longer it'll keep running, the way it's going.

80.speaker: Dammon
80.text: I'll see what I can do to give you more time if you find some infernal iron, but a machine that complicated is going to need serious work - more than a pauper's forge can handle.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: I think I picked up some of that infernal iron already. Can we at least see what you can do?

64.speaker: Dammon
64.text: Hm - looks like it went missing. I'll be here if you find it.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: I'll take whatever it is you're offering.

74.speaker: Dammon
74.text: I've sensed some during our travels. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: Thanks, mate. You'll be seeing me again soon.

89.speaker: Dammon
89.text: Thought I sensed an infernal around here. But you aren't from Elturel. What's your story?

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: I only recently escaped the Hells. I was enlisted against my will by the archdevil Zariel.

24.speaker: Dammon
24.text: Sounds familiar. When our city fell into Avernus, Zariel's commanders put me to work in their forges.

27.speaker: Dammon
27.text: Vicious bastards, the lot of them, but it helped that they thought I had some utility.

51.speaker: Dammon
51.text: They must've thought the same of you. That's infernal machinery I smell, isn't it? And running awfully hot. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: Elturel - your city was swallowed up by Avernus, right?

92.speaker: Dammon
92.text: It didn't take 'em long to notice I had some utility and stick me in the forges.

14.speaker: Dammon
14.text: And, if you don't mind me saying, it seems they got to you too. There's infernal machinery inside you, right? Very, very hot infernal machinery.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: Be my guest. But don't get too close, or your eyes'll melt shut.

96.speaker: Dammon
96.text: That thing isn't meant to operate outside Avernus. I'm not sure how much longer it'll keep running, the way it's going.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: I have some infernal iron right here. Take it.

18.speaker: Dammon
18.text: Hm - looks like it went missing. I'll be here if you find it.

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Will you be able to turn down the temperature a little? I haven't touched anyone in a long time.

39.speaker: Dammon
39.text: I'd worry about surviving the night first. But help one, help both: if we can cool you off, it'll stabilise your engine and allow you to touch whomever you please.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Where should I look for infernal iron?

73.speaker: Dammon
73.text: I've sensed some during our travels. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.
73.context: InternalNodeContext: This will be handled in the map/ journal UI, no need for any anims here.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: Thanks a lot. I'll be back when I find that infernal iron.

98.speaker: Dammon
98.text: Looking forward to it. It's been a while since I was able to work with anything from the Hells. I won't say I miss it, but... well, maybe I do.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Do you know what you're doing?

94.speaker: Dammon
94.text: I like to think so. Especially when I smell machinery running itself out like a miniature giant space hamster on a cosmic wheel.

44.speaker: Dammon
44.text: Didn't mean to overstep. Keep an eye on that thing, though. I don't like what I'm smelling - for your sake, that is.

20.speaker: Dammon
20.text: Meanwhile, I've still got plenty of weapons and armour in stock if you're looking to load up.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: Never mind my story. You sensed an infernal?

69.speaker: Dammon
69.text: Infernal machinery, anyway. Smells like it's running awfully hot. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil.

72.speaker: Dammon
72.text: And the closer you get, the stronger it smells.
